ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class really helped me in my thinking skills, my evaluative skills, my criticism skills, my analytical skills, and writing skills. Also helped me in formulating answers for the topics in class.
I learned how to think strategically and originally on topics of lies and deception.
I learned a lot about philosophy and the meaning of different philosophical terms. I also improved my writing and analysis skills significantly.

1. Reading
2. Writing 
3. Thinking
I learned about the development and transition of the definition of lies and deception, as well as the distinction between them. I also learned about the application of them.

The knowledge that I developed by taking this course would be how to think philosophically. The skills that I learned would be how to write and break down different philosophical works in order to see from a different perspective. The insights that I learned would be how to think philosophically to understand the different aspects involved with the situation and personal opinions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really loved this class because it was very challenging and fun. I don't think there were any weaknesses in this class. But I do think that maybe sending the readings out the day before class would be better than the day of.
I loved this course, I just wish there was more time to absorb information and to read analytially.

The course was very well taught. I think the only way it could have been improved was if we had focused on each topic longer, but I think that was impossible because of the time constraints of a 5-week course. I found the classes and readings very engaging and the professor explained everything clearly.

Strengths
1. Many chances to practice reading, writing, and thinking skills. 
2. Relatively smaller sized class.
3. Interesting topic.
4. Well-structured syllabus.
5. Engaging topics for assignments. 

Weakness: There were no weaknesses.
It's basically perfect!

The strengths of this course would be the structure of the course because the different interactions of the course made the information that was being taught to be interesting. A weakness of the course would be the different terminology that was taught because some were similar in the way it was interpreted which made the course a bit challenging and hard to understand at certain points.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to another student because it was very interesting and interactive. The teacher is amazing and I really enjoyed this class.
I would, it is challenging but rewarding. I was never bored, and classes were always entertaining.

I would absolutely recommed this course to another student. I think it would be interesting to anyone, even those not interested in philosophy, because of the way the class is taught. Professor Mahon engaged the class in all his lessons, asked our opinions on various subjects, was very energetic, was excited to talk to students outside of class, and showed a great amount of knowledge in his field.

Yes, because no matter what level of academic reading and writing the students starts from, there is so much to learn from taking this course, from knowledge on a specific topic to more intangible skills like reading, thinking, and writing.
Yes! It's really an interesting introduction for outsiders to philosophy; For philosophy student, it provides a brand new perspective of studying philosophy that is close to life and intriguing

I would recommend this course to another student because learning about philosophy makes you think and understand from a different person's perspective. Not only that, but this course would allow you to formulate your own opinions upon the topic which makes the in class discussions seem more interesting and appealing.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Strongly Agree
Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Agree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will definitely use the skills I learned in this class on a daily. It will definitely help me stay in the gray areas of lying.

I will definitely use the writing and analysis skills that I developed in this class in my future classes and career. I am also more interested in potentially studying philosophy after taking this class.

I will apply the reading skills that I learned from this course to learn things faster and more effectively. The way I read any kind of text, from newspapers to academic papers, changed after taking this course. Instead of losing my focus on minor details, I now focus on the main point of each paragraph or the whole article. It is helping me grasp any information better.
The knowledge and skills that I learned in this course can be applied in my future endeavors when I attend a political class or a philosophical class.

extras.title: EP&E S270 01/PHIL S337 01/PLSC S336 01 - Lies and Deception
